availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper with a Democratic, antislavery focus. Publisher(s): John Hopkins Harney (1844 to 1868), William E. Hughes (1860). Editor(s): J. H. Harney(1844 to 1868), J. H. Harney, William E. Hughes and William Wallace Harney (1860).

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 1104.
Bryan S. Bush, Louisville and the Civil War: A History & Guide, Charleston, SC: History Press, 2008.
The Encyclopedia of Louisville, ed. John E. Kleber (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2015), 366, 656.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), 357.
